title: Meghan Markle and Prince Harry lose impressive title to a very famous face
text:

Meghan Markle and Prince Harry delighted fans earlier this year when they set up their own Instagram page, stepping away from the account they previously shared with the Duke and Duchess of Cambridge.

The couple now use it to share messages and photos, including inspirational quotes from people they look up to and details of official engagements.

When they set it up in April they set a new record by getting more than a million followers in just five hours and 45 minutes.

But this week they lost their crown - to actress Jennifer Aniston.

Social media went into overdrive when Jen set up her account , sharing a photo of her with her Friends co-stars.

And her social media debut didn't disappoint, and she posted a selfie of her smiling alongside David Schwimmer, Courteney Cox, Lisa Kudrow, Matt LeBlanc and Matthew Perry - the first ever full reunion snap of the actors.

(Image: Instagram)

Jen playfully captioned the offering: "And now we’re Instagram FRIENDS too. HI INSTAGRAM."

Her bio reads: "My friends call me Jen."

Her account reached a million followers in five hours and 16 minutes, beating Meghan and Harry by half an hour - sorry guys!

Fans took to the comments to share their excitement of her joining the picture upload service.

One penned: "I love this so much" alongside a crying face.

(Image: NBC via Getty Images)

Another added: "This is a moment!."

Some gushed: "our besties all together!!!!!" and "Oh yeah mama!! Woooohooooo."

She later posted another video joking about "breaking the internet".

She wrote: "I swear I didn’t mean to break it... Thank you guys for the kind, glitchy welcome" with a red heart emoji.

(Image: Getty Images)

Jen's social media debut comes after she admitted she is not keen on taking part in a Friends reboot.

During an interview on Howard Stern's Sirius XM Radio, the actress confessed that while she missed the show, a reboot wasn't a good idea.

She told the radio host: "We all miss it every day. I would be nothing without it […] If there’s a reboot of the show, it won’t be as good as what it was, so why do it? It would ruin it."

Her words echoed those of Friends co-creator Marta Kauffman who has always insisted that a reboot would never happen.
description: Meghan Markle and Prince Harry set a new record when they launched their official SussexRoyal Instagram account in April, but this week they lost their crown
